snippet.textDisplay: My bet is that since they made note of how they're bringing it over after the Japanese Miiverse had so many endless requests for it, I wouldn't be too surprised if NoJ never even knew we wanted it, and so they found out the copyright issues, got them resolved and they're getting it released now. Hopefully it sells well enough for us to see Mother and Mother 3 released to US and Europe as well!(translated of course)

snippet.textDisplay:
See, it could be that they kept Earthbound around until they needed to move more systems, more of a business decision than legal issues. I mean, I ordered my Wii U to play the game and I know a few who can attest to doing the same. It could also be to fill out the Wii U's library at a comparatively slow time.

I would like to think they did it because of the fanbase, but if that was the case they would have done it long ago.
snippet.textOriginal:
See, it could be that they kept Earthbound around until they needed to move more systems, more of a business decision than legal issues. I mean, I ordered my Wii U to play the game and I know a few who can attest to doing the same. It could also be to fill out the Wii U's library at a comparatively slow time.

I would like to think they did it because of the fanbase, but if that was the case they would have done it long ago.

snippet.textDisplay: Rejoice Earthbound fans, Nintendo﻿ hasn't completely given up on us outside of Japan! Today's announcement about its Wii U VC release made me very happy, especially knowing how hard/expensive the original cartidge is. So I have to wonder, what previously kept Nintendo from releasing it? We always thought it was because of copyright problems around the soundtrack, but why would that suddenly not matter anymore? Next step, getting Mother and Mother 3 officially translated!
snippet.textOriginal: Rejoice Earthbound fans, Nintendo﻿ hasn't completely given up on us outside of Japan! Today's announcement about its Wii U VC release made me very happy, especially knowing how hard/expensive the original cartidge is. So I have to wonder, what previously kept Nintendo from releasing it? We always thought it was because of copyright problems around the soundtrack, but why would that suddenly not matter anymore? Next step, getting Mother and Mother 3 officially translated!
